text.p: Austrian insurer Wiener Staedtische Allgemeine Versicherung said premium income in the first nine months rose to 13.77 billion schillings, up 13 percent from a year ago, as its life insurance business boomed.

Life insurance premiums alone were up 43.5 percent at 5.118 billion schillings in the January-September period, the group said in a statement. "Wiener Staedtische has made optimal use of the strong demand for private insurance products," it said.
Premiums for damage and accident insurance rose one percent to 6.157 billion schillings, while health insurance premiums fell 1.4 percent to 2.495 billion schillings.
Wiener Staedtische's preference shares closed unchanged at 980 schillings on the Vienna bourse on Monday.
